sen.j: 好子内親王（こうし（よしこ）ないしんのう、生年不詳 - 建久3年7月3日 (旧暦)（1192年8月12日））は、平安時代末期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Koshi (Koshi (Yoshiko) Naishinno, year of birth unknown - August 12, 1192) was a member of Imperial family in the end of Heian period.
Imperial Princess Koshi (Koshi/Yoshiko Naishinno, year of birth unknown - August 12, 1192) was a member of the Imperial family in the end of the Heian period.
Imperial Princess Koshi (also known as Yoshiko, year of birth unknown - August 12, 1192) was a member of the Imperial Family in the end of the Heian period.
She was Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).
She was an Ise Saigu (a vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).
She was an Ise Saigu (a vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).

sen.j: 後白河天皇の第2皇女で、母は高倉三位藤原成子（大納言藤原季成女）。
sen.e: She was second Princess of Emperor Goshirakawa, and her mother was Takakura-Sanmi FUJIWARA no Shigeko (daughter of Dainagon, or chief councilor of state, FUJIWARA no Suenari).
She was the second Princess of Emperor Goshirakawa, and her mother was Takakura-Sanmi FUJIWARA no Shigeko (daughter of Dainagon, or chief councilor of state, FUJIWARA no Suenari).
She was the second Princess of Emperor Goshirakawa, and her mother was Takakura-Sanmi FUJIWARA no Shigeko (daughter of Dainagon, or chief councilor of state, FUJIWARA no Suenari).

sen.j: 同母兄弟に以仁王・守覚法親王・亮子内親王（殷富門院）・式子内親王・休子内親王らがいる。
sen.e: She had Prince Mochihito, Cloistered Imperial Prince Shukaku, Imperial Princess Ryoshi (Inpumonin), Imperial Princess Shikishi, Imperial Princess Kyushi, and others as her real brothers.
Her siblings included Prince Mochihito, Cloistered Imperial Prince Shukaku, Imperial Princess Ryoshi (Inpumonin), Imperial Princess Shikishi, and Imperial Princess Kyushi.
sen.cmt: this translator needs to learn that “brothers” are all male
sen.e: Her siblings included Prince Mochihito, Cloistered Imperial Prince Shukaku, Imperial Princess Ryoshi (Inpumonin), Imperial Princess Shikishi, and Imperial Princess Kyushi.

sen.j: 保元3年（1158年）異母兄二条天皇の斎宮に卜定された。
sen.e: In 1158, she was selected by bokujo (to decide by fortunetelling) as Saigu of Emperor Nijo, her older half-brother.
In 1158, she was selected by divination to be the Saigu of Emperor Nijo, her older half-brother.
In 1158, she was selected by bokujo (to decide by fortunetelling) to be the Saigu of Emperor Nijo, her older half-brother.

sen.j: 永暦元年（1160年）伊勢に群行。
sen.e: In 1160, she made Gunko (Saigu heading to Ise after the purification) to Ise.
In 1160, she went to Ise.
sen.cmt: I don't think what was written really made the meaning any clearer that simply “went”
sen.e: In 1160, she went to Ise.

sen.j: 永万元年（1165年）二条天皇の譲位により退下。
sen.e: In 1165, she resigned by abdication of the throne of Emperor Nijo.
In 1165, she resigned because of Emperor Nijo's abdication of the throne.
In 1165, she resigned because of Emperor Nijo's abdication of the throne.
She died in July, 1192.
She died in July, 1192.
She died in August, 1192.
